instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the battery’s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> cant detect the battery
threads.message:
hello i have <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> after he DIY changing the battery for his macbook cant on,
but when i try put the charger can on but not recognise the battery.

after inspecting the motherboard i measure the battery terminal
diode to ground
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> OL
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> OL
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> OL
i noticed that <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR> is burnt.

after i change <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>,<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>...

J6950
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> 0.589 3.29V
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> 0.506 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> 0.686 8.59v
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> 0.609 3.28V

battery still not detected.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> cant detect the battery
threads.message: can close thread after reballing <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> can detect battery already, anyway thanks!
